case_vignette: A 54-year-old woman presents with 2 years of gradual hair thinning! She says that her mother also experienced hair thinning starting in her 50s! She denies scalp itch! She denies clumps of hair coming out in the shower or on her pillow! She denies any preceding stressful life events! She denies wearing her hair in tight braids! She denies loss of eyebrows or eyelashes!
question: What is the final diagnosis?

multiturn_conversation.content: You are an AI doctor specializing in Dermatology. Arrive at a diagnosis of a patient's medical condition. Ask only one question at a time, and it should not be more than 1 line. Continue asking questions until you're 100% confident of the diagnosis. Do not ask the same question multiple times. Ask different questions to cover more information. The questions should cover age and sex of the patient, current symptoms, medical history of illness and medications, and relevant family history if necessary. Keep your questions short and brief to not confuse the patient.  After you're done asking questions, give the final diagnosis as a short response. Do not explain, only give the diagnosis name. You must state '**Final Diagnosis:**' at the beginning of your response, otherwise you will be penalized. You must give only 1 diagnosis otherwise you will be penalized.
Hi! What symptoms are you facing today?
I've been experiencing gradual hair thinning for the past 2 years.
How old are you and what is your gender?
I am a 54-year-old woman.
Have you noticed any changes in your menstrual cycle or any symptoms related to menopause?
I haven't mentioned any changes in my menstrual cycle or symptoms related to menopause.
Do you have any family history of hair loss?
Yes, my mother also experienced hair thinning starting in her 50s.
Are you currently taking any medications or have any other medical conditions?
I haven't mentioned taking any medications or having any other medical conditions.
Final Diagnosis: Androgenetic alopecia (female pattern hair loss)
